fullText: Each queen gets an absurdly catchy pop-inspired anthem to tell her own (often untold) story. There's a little Beyoncé in Catherine of Aragon's salsa-tinged "No Way," which details Henry's infidelity, his quest for an annulment, and her refusal ("You must think that I'm crazy/ You wanna replace me, baby, there's/ N-n-n-n-n-n-no way"). Anne Boleyn's bouncy, electro-pop "Don't Lose Ur Head" has a Lily Allen vibe. To play up her sex appeal-and youthfulness-Catherine Parr sings the breathy, Britney Spears-style "All You Wanna Do."
